channel.title: Time too laugh at jagex again!
channel.description:
We would like to remind our players that it is against the rules to buy or sell RuneScape items for reallife money. We have this rule for three reasons: Firstly because we donâ€™t want RuneScape to be just a game in which you can buy your way to success, if we let players start doing this it devalues the game for other players. We feel your status in real-life shouldnâ€™t affect your ability to be successful in the game. Secondly we cannot see the half of the transaction which occurs outside the game, and if players swap items for external benefits we canâ€™t see, to us it looks like an unbalanced suspicious trade. Thirdly, often when players attempt to break this rule and sell items for real cash the items are actually stolen, so you could even end up getting in trouble for receiving stolen property. If you purchased an account you might find it suddenly returned to the original rightful owner and yourself out of pocket. We have recently launched a new tracking system which means we can detect this sort of 'real life' trading very easily. We maintain a list of accounts which are known to sell items in breach of this rule, and watch who trades with them. This means if you buy an item off someone we are watching we will know about it. We would also like to remind players that there are NO official RuneScape gold websites. Even if the site you are thinking about buying/selling RuneScape gold with looks professional, it doesn't mean it's a service we are running, and you will still get banned for using it. In the last week we banned 992 accounts for real-world trading related offenses, as we have very reliable methods for spotting this sort of thing now. We've even had queries from players complaining they didn't receive an item they paid real-life money for - which given it's against the rules anyway seems a strange thing to tell us! So PLEASE make sure you read all our rules, which can be found here.
here is the funny part Thirdly, often when players attempt to break this rule and sell items for real cash the items are actually stolen, so you could even end up getting in trouble for receiving stolen property. ^^ yes because they have all items in the game with unique id for every item which shows who owns what :p heres another funny: as we have very reliable methods for spotting this sort of thing now. ^^ if they had that more than 992 accounts would of been banned We've even had queries from players complaining they didn't receive an item they paid real-life money for - which given it's against the rules anyway seems a strange thing to tell us! So PLEASE make sure you read all our rules, which can be found here ^^ one word....... NOOBS

item.title: Time too laugh at jagex again!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

arraness14:

[quote author=ruler link=topic=102.msg1302#msg1302 date=1141177166]
they are tracking all trades even drop trades.

Just use aryan for drop trades...If they catch you just say That I saw a pile of items and I picked them up.[/quote]

it's like this::

Player 1: I'm just gonna drop all these items
Player 1 On Another Account: Hey Those are my items from my other account
Andrew Manblower: They are? Well go get them!!!!!
Player 1: Cool Thanx
Andrew Manblower: NP, don't worry, we deleted our tracking systems and I'm too stupid
Andrwe Manblower: To ban you cause i have no proof that you did it!! Even though I saw you do it!!

I got that from one of my ban messages look::

Now it's time to laugh @ Jagex::
There is no evidence that you were not in charge of this account at the time this report was filed. Therefore the ban on this account is permanent and no further ban appeals will be accepted.

PS

The Un-Named:

That's what I was thinking. They might have somthing like this:

X drops X of X at coords xX yX. Y picjs uo X of X at coords xX, yX.

That's exactly what drop trading is.

Read full topic
item.source: Time too laugh at jagex again!

The only way they can see it, is if they have Video Logs on what is going wrong, which would use up all there bandwidth, meaning there is no more runescape. There are other ways, but I'm not going to get into them.

@The_Un-Named wrote:

Here's a simpler version

Mod 1: Lets have a new tracking system to detect real world item traders!
Mod 1: I'll leave you to do it.
Mod 2: ok sir...
short pause
Mod 1 walks out.
Mod 2: If I delete this then it should make a new tracking system
Mod 2 deletes the orignal tracking system
Mod 2: dur...
